canonical_explanation.text: Animals are living things that live all around us. Some animals live with us and help us. These are called domestic animals, like cows, hens, goats, and horses. Some animals are dangerous and live in forests. These are called wild animals, like lions, tigers, elephants, and deer. Some animals are our friends and live in our homes. These are called pet animals, like dogs, cats, rabbits, and parrots. Baby animals have special names: a baby dog is a puppy, a baby cat is a kitten, a baby cow is a calf, and a baby hen is a chick. Animals live in different homes: birds live in nests, dogs live in kennels, horses live in stables, and lions live in dens. Different animals eat different food: some eat only plants (like cows and goats), some eat only meat (like lions and tigers), and some eat both plants and meat (like dogs and bears).
rules: Domestic animals live with people and help us (cow, hen, goat, horse, buffalo).
Wild animals live in forests and can be dangerous (lion, tiger, elephant, deer).
Pet animals are kept at home for company (dog, cat, rabbit, parrot, fish).
Baby animals have special names: puppy, kitten, calf, chick, cub, lamb, foal.
Animals have different homes: nest, den, stable, kennel, burrow, coop.
Some animals eat plants, some eat meat, and some eat both.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a domestic animal?
questions.explanation_correct: A cow is a domestic animal. It lives with people and gives us milk. Domestic animals are useful to us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions, tigers, and deer are wild animals that live in forests. A cow lives with people and helps us, so it is a domestic animal.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a wild animal?
questions.explanation_correct: A tiger is a wild animal. It lives in the forest and is very strong and dangerous. Wild animals do not live with people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, and hens live with people. They are domestic or pet animals. A tiger is a wild animal that lives in the forest.

questions.question_text: A baby dog is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A baby dog is called a puppy. Puppies are small and cute, and they grow up to become dogs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kitten is a baby cat. A calf is a baby cow. A chick is a baby hen. A baby dog is called a puppy.

questions.question_text: Where does a bird live?
questions.explanation_correct: A bird lives in a nest. Birds build nests using twigs, grass, and leaves on trees or high places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kennel is for dogs. A stable is for horses. A den is for lions. Birds live in nests that they build on trees.

questions.question_text: A cow eats:
questions.explanation_correct: A cow eats grass and plants. Cows are animals that eat only plants. They munch on grass, hay, and green plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cows do not eat meat, fish, or stones. They are plant-eating animals and love to eat green grass and hay.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a pet animal?
questions.explanation_correct: A rabbit is a pet animal. Many people keep rabbits at home because they are cute, soft, and friendly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Elephants, crocodiles, and bears are wild animals. A rabbit is small and gentle and can be kept as a pet at home.

questions.question_text: A baby cat is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A baby cat is called a kitten. Kittens are tiny and playful, and they grow up to become cats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A puppy is a baby dog. A cub is a baby lion or bear. A lamb is a baby sheep. A baby cat is called a kitten.

questions.question_text: Where does a horse live?
questions.explanation_correct: A horse lives in a stable. A stable is a building where horses are kept, with food and water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds. Dens are for lions. Burrows are for rabbits. Horses live in stables.

questions.question_text: A lion eats:
questions.explanation_correct: A lion eats meat. Lions are strong animals that hunt other animals for food. They eat the meat of animals like deer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions do not eat grass, fruits, or rice. They are meat-eating animals that hunt other animals in the forest.

questions.question_text: A baby cow is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A baby cow is called a calf. Calves are small and cute, and they drink their mother's milk to grow big and strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A chick is a baby hen. A foal is a baby horse. A puppy is a baby dog. A baby cow is called a calf.

questions.question_text: Which animal gives us milk?
questions.explanation_correct: A cow gives us milk. Cow's milk is used to make butter, curd, paneer, and ghee. Cows are very useful domestic animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hens give us eggs. Parrots and fish do not give us milk. Cows are domestic animals that give us milk every day.

questions.question_text: Where does a lion live?
questions.explanation_correct: A lion lives in a den. A den is like a cave or a hiding place in the forest where the lion rests and keeps its cubs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kennels are for dogs. Stables are for horses. Coops are for hens. Lions live in dens in the forest.

questions.question_text: Which animal gives us eggs?
questions.explanation_correct: A hen gives us eggs. Hens are domestic birds that are kept on farms and in homes. Their eggs are very good food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cows give milk. Dogs are pets. Goats give milk. Hens are the animals that lay eggs for us to eat.

questions.question_text: A baby hen is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A baby hen is called a chick. Chicks are small, fluffy, and yellow. They hatch from eggs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A calf is a baby cow. A puppy is a baby dog. A kitten is a baby cat. A baby hen is called a chick.

questions.question_text: A dog lives in a:
questions.explanation_correct: A dog lives in a kennel. A kennel is a small house made for a dog to sleep and rest in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds. Stables are for horses. Burrows are for rabbits. A dog lives in a kennel.

questions.question_text: A goat eats:
questions.explanation_correct: A goat eats leaves and grass. Goats are plant-eating animals that love to munch on green leaves and grass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Goats do not eat meat, stones, or books. They are plant-eating animals that eat green leaves, grass, and hay.

questions.question_text: A baby lion is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A baby lion is called a cub. Cubs are small and playful. They live with their mother in the forest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A puppy is a baby dog. A chick is a baby hen. A calf is a baby cow. A baby lion is called a cub.

questions.question_text: Where does a rabbit live?
questions.explanation_correct: A rabbit lives in a burrow. A burrow is a hole in the ground where a rabbit hides and rests safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds. Stables are for horses. Dens are for lions. Rabbits live in burrows dug in the ground.

questions.question_text: A baby sheep is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A baby sheep is called a lamb. Lambs are small and have soft, woolly fur. They stay close to their mother.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kitten is a baby cat. A chick is a baby hen. A puppy is a baby dog. A baby sheep is called a lamb.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a wild animal?
questions.explanation_correct: An elephant is a wild animal. It lives in forests and is the biggest land animal. Wild elephants should not be disturbed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hens, goats, and buffaloes are domestic animals that live with people. Elephants are wild animals that live in forests.

questions.question_text: Ravi has a pet that says 'meow' and loves to drink milk. What pet does Ravi have?
questions.explanation_correct: Ravi has a cat. Cats say 'meow' and love to drink milk. Cats are common pet animals in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs bark. Parrots talk. Rabbits are quiet. An animal that says 'meow' and drinks milk is a cat.

questions.question_text: A farmer keeps cows, hens, and goats. These are all:
questions.explanation_correct: Cows, hens, and goats are domestic animals. They live with people and are very useful. Cows give milk, hens give eggs, and goats give milk too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: These animals are not wild or forest animals. They are domestic animals that farmers keep because they are useful.

questions.question_text: A baby horse is called a foal. When the foal grows up, it becomes a:
questions.explanation_correct: A foal is a baby horse. When it grows up, it becomes a horse. Baby animals always grow up to become the same kind of animal as their parents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A foal does not become a dog, cow, or goat. A foal is a baby horse, and it grows up to be a horse.

questions.question_text: Where do hens live on a farm?
questions.explanation_correct: Hens live in a coop on a farm. A coop is a small house for hens where they sleep and lay eggs safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kennels are for dogs. Stables are for horses. Dens are for lions. Hens live in a coop.

questions.question_text: A bear eats both honey and fish. This means a bear eats:
questions.explanation_correct: A bear eats both honey (from plants) and fish (an animal). This means it eats both plants and animals. Some animals eat both kinds of food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bear does not eat only plants or only meat. It eats honey, fruits, and also fish. So it eats both plant food and animal food.

questions.question_text: Why should we not go near wild animals?

options.text: They can be dangerous and hurt us

questions.explanation_correct: Wild animals can be dangerous. Lions, tigers, and bears are very strong and can hurt us. We should watch them only from far away or in a zoo.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wild animals are not small or slow. They are strong and can be dangerous. We should always stay away from wild animals.

questions.question_text: Sita's dog had four puppies. This shows that dogs can:
questions.explanation_correct: Dogs can have babies called puppies. This shows that dogs are living things that can reproduce and have baby animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs cannot fly, talk, or read. But they can have babies called puppies. Having babies is something all living animals can do.

questions.question_text: A monkey lives in trees in the forest. A monkey is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A monkey is a wild animal. It lives in trees in the forest and finds its own food. It does not live with people like domestic animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Monkeys do not live in our homes or on farms. They live freely in trees in forests. So they are wild animals.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals eats only plants?
questions.explanation_correct: A deer eats only plants like grass and leaves. It does not eat meat. Deer are gentle plant-eating animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions, tigers, and eagles eat meat. They hunt other animals for food. Deer eat only plants like grass and leaves.

questions.question_text: Anil saw a spider making a web. The web is the spider's:
questions.explanation_correct: A spider's web is its home. The spider builds the web to live in and also to catch insects for food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A web is not the spider's food, toy, or clothes. It is the spider's home where it lives and catches its food.

questions.question_text: Which animal eats only meat?
questions.explanation_correct: A tiger eats only meat. It hunts deer and other animals in the forest. Tigers are very strong meat-eating animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cows, goats, and rabbits eat only plants. A tiger is a meat-eating animal that hunts other animals for food.

questions.question_text: A parrot can talk and is kept at home. A parrot is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A parrot is a pet animal. Many people keep parrots at home because they are colourful and can learn to talk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When a parrot is kept at home, it is a pet. Pet animals live with people in their homes for company and fun.

questions.question_text: A dog eats chapati and also meat. This means a dog eats:
questions.explanation_correct: A dog eats both chapati (made from wheat, a plant) and meat. This means it eats both plant food and animal food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs do not eat only plants or only meat. They eat both types of food like chapati, rice, and meat.

questions.question_text: Match the baby animal to its parent: Cub is to Lion as Calf is to ___
questions.explanation_correct: A cub is a baby lion. A calf is a baby cow. So calf goes with cow, just like cub goes with lion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A baby dog is a puppy. A baby hen is a chick. A baby cat is a kitten. A calf is a baby cow.

questions.question_text: Match the animal to its home: Dog is to Kennel as Horse is to ___
questions.explanation_correct: A dog lives in a kennel. A horse lives in a stable. So stable goes with horse, just like kennel goes with dog.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds. Dens are for lions. Burrows are for rabbits. A horse lives in a stable.

questions.question_text: Which group has ONLY domestic animals?
questions.explanation_correct: Cow, hen, and goat are all domestic animals. They live with people and give us milk, eggs, and other useful things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A has lion (wild). Option C has all wild animals. Option D has tiger (wild). Only option B has all domestic animals.

questions.question_text: Which group has ONLY wild animals?
questions.explanation_correct: Lion, tiger, and deer are all wild animals. They live in forests and do not live with people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Options A and D have domestic or pet animals. Option B has all domestic animals. Only option C has all wild animals.

questions.question_text: A crow eats grain and also worms. What kind of food does a crow eat?

options.text: Both plant food and animal food

questions.explanation_correct: A crow eats grain (from plants) and worms (animals). So a crow eats both plant food and animal food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A crow does not eat only plants or only meat. It eats both grains and worms, so it eats both types of food.

questions.question_text: Which animal's home is called a burrow?
questions.explanation_correct: A rabbit's home is called a burrow. It is a hole dug in the ground where the rabbit lives and hides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Horses live in stables. Birds live in nests. Lions live in dens. Rabbits live in burrows.

questions.question_text: A cow is a domestic animal.
questions.explanation_correct: A cow is a domestic animal. It lives with people, eats grass and hay, and gives us milk every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A cow is a domestic animal that lives with people and is very useful.

questions.question_text: A baby cat is called a puppy.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A baby cat is called a kitten, not a puppy. A puppy is a baby dog.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A baby cat is a kitten. A puppy is a baby dog. These are different animals with different baby names.

questions.question_text: A bird lives in a nest.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Birds build nests on trees and high places using twigs, grass, and leaves. They lay eggs in their nests.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Birds do live in nests. They build them on trees and other high places to keep their eggs and babies safe.

questions.question_text: A tiger eats grass.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A tiger does not eat grass. Tigers eat meat. They hunt deer and other animals for food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tigers are meat-eating animals. They do not eat grass or plants. They hunt and eat other animals.

questions.question_text: A lion is a pet animal.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A lion is a wild animal, not a pet. Lions are dangerous and live in forests. We should never try to keep a lion as a pet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions are wild animals. They are very dangerous and live in forests. Dogs, cats, and rabbits are pets, not lions.

questions.question_text: A baby horse is called a foal.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A baby horse is called a foal. Foals have long legs and can stand up soon after they are born.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A baby horse is indeed called a foal. Foals grow up to become horses.

questions.question_text: Hens live in stables.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Hens do not live in stables. They live in coops. Stables are for horses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stables are homes for horses, not hens. Hens live in coops where they lay eggs and sleep safely.

questions.question_text: A deer eats only plants.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Deer eat only plants like grass, leaves, and fruits. They do not eat meat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Deer are plant-eating animals. They eat grass, leaves, and plants. They do not hunt or eat other animals.

questions.question_text: A dog is both a domestic animal and a pet animal.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A dog is both domestic (it lives with people) and a pet (people keep it for company and love). Dogs are very friendly animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs live with people and are loved as friends. They can be called both domestic and pet animals.

questions.question_text: All animals eat the same food.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Different animals eat different food. Cows eat grass. Lions eat meat. Bears eat both plants and meat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all animals eat the same food. Some eat plants, some eat meat, and some eat both.

questions.question_text: Wild animals live in forests and should not be kept at home.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Wild animals like lions, tigers, and elephants belong in forests. They are happiest and safest in their natural homes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wild animals need forests to live freely. Keeping them at home is dangerous and not good for the animals.
